title: Travel ban not expected to keep international athletes out of U.S. events
text: “The IOC has been informed by the United States Olympic Committee (USOC) about the pledge of cooperation it received from the U.S. government with regard to expedited access to the United States for athletes and officials in order to participate in international sports competitions,” the statement said. “The IOC welcomes the initiative by USOC and trusts that international competitions in the United States continue to take place in line with the Olympic values of friendship, excellence and respect’.”
summary:
“The IOC has been informed by the United States Olympic Committee (USOC) about the pledge of cooperation it received from the U.S. government with regard to expedited access to the United States for athletes and officials in order to participate in international sports competitions,” the statement said.
“The IOC welcomes the initiative by USOC and trusts that international competitions in the United States continue to take place in line with the Olympic values of friendship, excellence and respect’.”
